title: Classic Beef Stir Fry
description: Quick and flavorful beef stir fry with crisp vegetables in a savory sauce

items.ingredient: beef sirloin, sliced thin against the grain

instructions.instruction: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, sesame oil, and beef broth.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the pan. Add broccoli and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add bell peppers and onion, stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return beef to the pan and add the sauce mixture.
Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens and coats everything.
Remove from heat and garnish with green onions.
Serve immediately over steamed rice.

notes: Cut beef against the grain for tenderness
Have all ingredients prepped before you start cooking
High heat is essential for proper stir-frying
variations: Add snap peas or carrots for different vegetables
Use chicken or pork instead of beef
Add cashews or peanuts for crunch
Spice it up with red pepper flakes
storage: Best served immediately, but leftovers keep for 2 days in refrigerator

title: Grandma's Fluffy Buttermilk Pancakes
description: Light, fluffy pancakes that melt in your mouth - a family recipe passed down through generations

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs and then whisk in buttermilk, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Don't overmix - a few lumps are okay.
Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat. Lightly grease with butter or oil.
Pour ¼ cup of batter for each pancake onto the hot griddle.
Cook until bubbles form on surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes. Flip and cook until golden brown, 1-2 minutes more.
Serve immediately with butter and maple syrup.

notes: For extra fluffy pancakes, separate the eggs and beat the whites until stiff peaks form, then fold into the batter at the end
Don't overmix the batter - this will make tough pancakes
Keep cooked pancakes warm in a 200°F oven while making the rest
variations: Add ½ cup fresh blueberries to the batter
Substitute half the flour with whole wheat flour for a heartier texture
Add 1 tablespoon lemon zest for citrus pancakes
storage: Leftover pancakes can be stored in the refrigerator for 3 days or frozen for up to 2 months

title: Overnight French Toast Casserole
description: Make-ahead breakfast casserole that's perfect for feeding a crowd on special mornings

items.ingredient: brioche or challah bread, sliced thick

instructions.instruction: Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange bread slices in the dish, overlapping slightly.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, cream, ½ cup brown sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt.
Pour the egg mixture evenly over the bread. Press down gently to help bread absorb the liquid.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight (at least 8 hours).
In the morning, preheat oven to 350°F. Remove casserole from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking.
In a small bowl, mix remaining ¼ cup brown sugar with flour. Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Remove plastic wrap and sprinkle the crumb topping over the casserole.
Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown and set in the center.
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Dust with powdered sugar if desired.

notes: Use day-old bread for best results - it absorbs the custard better
Can be assembled up to 2 days ahead
If the top browns too quickly, cover with foil
variations: Add ½ cup fresh berries between the bread layers
Substitute maple syrup for some of the brown sugar
Add chopped pecans to the crumb topping
storage: Leftovers keep in the refrigerator for 3 days and can be reheated in the oven

title: Perfect Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Crispy edges, chewy centers, and loaded with chocolate chips - the ultimate comfort cookie

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter and both sugars until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
Gradually mix in the flour mixture until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips with a wooden spoon.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9-11 minutes until edges are golden brown but centers still look slightly underbaked.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

notes: Don't overbake - cookies will continue cooking on the hot pan
Room temperature ingredients mix better
Chill dough for 30 minutes for thicker cookies
variations: Add 1 cup chopped walnuts or pecans
Use dark chocolate chips for richer flavor
Add 1 teaspoon cinnamon for spiced cookies
Make them gluten-free with almond flour
storage: Store in airtight container for up to 1 week or freeze dough balls for up to 3 months

title: Classic Tiramisu
description: Authentic Italian tiramisu with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and creamy mascarpone

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale, about 5 minutes.
Add mascarpone to the egg mixture and whisk until smooth and combined.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
Gently fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone mixture in three additions.
Combine espresso and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger in the coffee mixture and arrange in a single layer in a 9x13 dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and remaining mascarpone mixture.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Before serving, dust with cocoa powder and grated chocolate if using.

notes: Use room temperature mascarpone to avoid lumps
Don't oversoak the ladyfingers or they'll become mushy
The longer it chills, the better the flavors meld
variations: Add a layer of fresh berries
Use amaretto instead of coffee liqueur
Make individual portions in glasses
Add a layer of chocolate shavings
storage: Best consumed within 2-3 days, covered in refrigerator

title: Angel Biscuits
description: Family recipe for Angel Biscuits. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix yeast and warm water.
Mix dry ingredients, cut in shortening.
Add buttermilk and yeast mixture.
Mix well with spoon.
Turn out on lightly floured surface.
Roll and cut.
Place on lightly greased baking sheet.
Let rise 1 hour at room temperature.
Bake in 350° oven about 15 minutes or until brown.

notes: Dough will keep in refrigerator several days if covered.

title: Applesauce Muffins
description: Family recipe for Applesauce Muffins. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat well.
Add cinnamon, soda, allspice and salt. Mix well. (over)
Add flour and applesauce. Blend well.
Stir in nuts.
Bake in paper cups or non-stick muffin pan (my preference) 25-30 minutes.
These muffins are color good without nuts.

title: Apricot Almond Scones
description: Family recipe for Apricot Almond Scones. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Advantium: 5-7 minutes (U: 6, L: 4, M: 2)
Advantium 120: 16-18 minutes (Med-Lo, Lo, •)

title: Baked Chicken Breasts En Casserole
description: Family recipe for Baked Chicken Breasts En Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Remove skin from chicken breasts; place in skillet. Add broth, wine, and enough water to cover. Bring to boil; simmer 15 minutes or until tender. Transfer with slotted spoon to casserole.
Boil down broth to ¼ cup.
Mix together onion, mayonnaise, lemon juice, sugar, reduced broth, and soup. Pour over chicken.
Bake in 350 oven 20 minutes. Cover with potato chips and almonds; bake 10 minutes. Yield 4 servings.

title: Baked Grits
description: Family recipe for Baked Grits. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: Salt to taste & pepper can be omitted

instructions.instruction: Mix all ingredients and bake in 325° oven for 25 or 30 min or until desired thickness. Some cheese sprinkled over top just before removing from oven also lets it brown & taste.
Goes great with pork, chicken etc. instead of potatoes. If you like garlic add garlic salt to taste.

title: Banana Nut Bread
description: Family recipe for Banana Nut Bread. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: *sift the above ingredients together and set aside*
*beat the above then fold in the*
*next fold in the flour mixture and add*

instructions.instruction: Grease and flour 2 6x3 loaf pans. Pour cake into pans and bake in preheated oven at 325° for about 45 or 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean.

title: Barley Soup
description: Family recipe for Barley Soup. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Wash barley and soak in water (covered) and slow heat for 2½ hours. Add other ingredients, except cabbage and milk and continue cooking over low heat for another hour. Add cabbage and cook another 30 min. Add milk and heat to boiling. Serve.

title: Becky Chicken Dumplings
description: Family recipe for Becky Chicken Dumplings. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: tea sp. salt/dry stock (if salted use less)
tea sp. freshly ground black pepper

instructions.instruction: Cut lard into flour, salt, soda and sugar; make ½ well in the flour, mix - and add buttermilk and egg; mix as for biscuit. Roll into a ball and put in refrig. while Chicken cooks - Put chicken in pan and cook with water, stock, butter, salt & pepper, simmer - 40 min or 60 min. Stir. T. Before chicken. Roll out dumpling - Cut in 1 inch squares. Drop dumpling into boiling stock. Pour on mile.
Put top on - put heat on that Tommy. J. Do not remove lid - Remove lid after 30 min.

title: Beef Bread
description: Family recipe for Beef Bread. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Sift sugar, salt, shortening together
Add buttermilk (sift soda and then stir)
Stir in flour & nuts & then the flour.
Put in loaf pan & baked at 325° for 1hr & 15 min.
2 cups flour
3/4 cup shortening or butter (2 sticks)
Add 1 pound grated cheese (american cheese) salt, red pepper or paprika.

title: Best Ever Salad
description: Family recipe for Best Ever Salad. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Dissolve gelatin in hot water, cool, add remaining ingredients. Chill until set.
Serve with mayonnaise or lettuce leaf.

This salad is delicious with ham, chicken or roast turkey. The horseradish may be omitted but it makes it good and different — (I use about one tablespoon horseradish and about ⅔ cup mayonnaise for calories sake)

(Use horseradish to suit taste)
(over)

title: Best Rolls
description: Family recipe for Best Rolls. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix 3/4 cup flour, sugar, salt and yeast in large bowl.
Combine milk, water and margarine in saucepan. Heat until very warm.
Gradually add milk mixture to dry ingredients and beat 2 minutes with electric mixer.
Add egg and ¼ cup flour. Beat at high speed 1-2 minutes.
Stir in enough flour to make a stiff dough.
Knead on floured surface about 10 minutes.
Shape into ball, place in greased bowl and turn to grease top.
Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Turn out on floured surface and

title: Black Bottom Pie
description: Family recipe for Black Bottom Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: baked pie shell or graham cracker crust

instructions.instruction: Scald milk. Mix 3/4 cups of sugar and flour thoroughly. Stir into milk.
Beat egg yolks until lemon colored. Gradually add milk mixture, stirring constantly.
Cook over low heat stirring until mixture thickens. Soften gelatin in cold water, add to mixture and stir until dissolved.
Divide mixture into two equal parts. To one part add cut up chocolate and stir until melted. Add one teaspoon of vanilla and stir. Cool, turn into pie shell.

Beat two of the egg whites. Add 1/4 cup of sugar. Add second teaspoon of vanilla. Fold egg whites into remaining cooled mixture. Spread over chocolate filling. Chill. Spread whipped cream on top. Grate a little chocolate on top of whipped cream.

notes: This is original recipe - I changed to - Add the 1 cup sugar to flour. If mixture is not thick when cooked add two envelopes of unflavored gelatin - Instead of adding beaten egg whites & folded in 1/4 cup or more of fat free cool whip - Grated of whipped cream & spread some cool whip on top.

title: Blueberry Pound Cake
description: Family recipe for Blueberry Pound Cake. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.
notes: by Strooney: Now, just in case you do not know what to do with it, eat a slice.

title: Boston Cream Pie
description: Family recipe for Boston Cream Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Beat egg whites, add sugar. In separate bowl, beat yolks until creamy and add vinegar. Fold yolks into whites. Fold in flour & bake in 3 pans at 350 until light brown about 20 minutes. Grease only bottom of pans.

title: Breakfastbrunch Roll Up
description: Family recipe for Breakfastbrunch Roll Up. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix all ingredients. Place rolls in circle, large ends to the inside; fill with mixture; roll small edges over mixture. Bake at 375 degrees until rolls are golden brown.

title: Breakfast Casserole
description: Family recipe for Breakfast Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cook sausage & ham, drain
Melt butter in 9 x 13 dish - tear bread into small pieces over butter. Sprinkle sausage over bread - sprinkle cheese over meat.
Beat eggs and other ingredients together. Pour over mixture until overnight. Bake at 350° for 40 or 50 minutes. Place foil over top to keep from browning too fast.

title: Broccoli Cheese Soup
description: Family recipe for Broccoli Cheese Soup. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Sauté onions in butter. Melt cheese while in butter. Cook broccoli in microwave.
Mix altogether - add broccoli. Add cheese & onion mix.
Mix soup with onion mix and serve.

title: Broccoli Rice Casserole
description: Family recipe for Broccoli Rice Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cook rice - 10 min - Drain in colander - Mix with rice in mixing bowl. Sauté garlic in oleo. Pour chilled & thawed soup & Cheez Whiz in oleo and mix well until Cheez is melted. Pour this over rice & broccoli and mix lightly - Put in casserole - Top with bread crumbles (with melted oleo over bread crumbles - Cook until bubbly and crumbs are light brown. (about 20-25 min.)

title: Broccoli Rice Casserole 1
description: Family recipe for Broccoli Rice Casserole 1. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cook rice - 10 min - Drain in colander - Mix with rice in mixing bowl. Sauté garlic in oleo. Pour chilled soup & Cheez Whiz in oleo and mix well until Cheez is melted. Pour this over rice & broccoli and mix lightly - Put in casserole - Top with bread crumbles (with melted oleo over bread crumbles - Cook until bubbly and crumbs are light brown. (about 20-25 min.))

notes:
This appears to be a duplicate of recipe #21 from the first batch.*

**Ingredients:**
- 1 package frozen chopped broccoli
- 1 can cream chicken soup
- 6 oz. Cheez Whiz
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 1 button garlic (small)
- 1 table sp. oleo

**Instructions:**
Cook rice - 10 min - Drain in colander - Mix with rice in mixing bowl. Sauté garlic in oleo. Pour chilled soup & Cheez Whiz in oleo and mix well until Cheez is melted. Pour this over rice & broccoli and mix lightly - Put in casserole - Top with bread crumbles (with melted oleo over bread crumbles - Cook until bubbly and crumbs are light brown. (about 20-25 min.))

title: Carrot Soup Louella Donelson
description: Family recipe for Carrot Soup Louella Donelson. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cook onion in butter until clear; add chicken broth, carrots, potato, sugar, orange peel, nutmeg, salt and simmer (covered) until vegetables are very soft. Whirl in electric blender (½ at a time) until creamy. Return to pan, stir in ½ & ½ and heat. Makes 6 cups.

If too much, half it. If keep in refrigerator (only couple days) add ½ & ½ to that portion when serving. Use a bit of lemon juice if don't have orange peel. If don't have chicken broth, I imagine instant broth would be O.K.
This is very delicious, does not taste like carrots. Full of vitamins of course and good any time.

title: Catfish Allison
description: Family recipe for Catfish Allison. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Place the cheese, butter, mayonnaise, onion, Worcestershire and Tabasco in a bowl and mix thoroughly. Butter mixture may be made 24 hours ahead and kept refrigerated.
Poach the catfish fillets in lightly simmering water for 4 to 5 minutes. Gently lift the fillets from the water and set aside to drain.
For individual servings, place the fillets in au gratin dishes and cover with 2 tablespoons of the cheese mixture. Broil for 2 to 3 minutes until the cheese mixture browns.

Without individual dishes, place fillets into a lightly baking dish. Cover each fillet with the cheese mixture and brown under the broiler. Carefully lift the fillets from the dish onto the plates and spoon some of the pan juices over each serving.

title: Catfish With Pecan Brown Butter Recipe
description: Family recipe for Catfish With Pecan Brown Butter Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

title: Chessy Catfish
description: Family recipe for Chessy Catfish. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: pan-dressed farm-raised catfish or 2 lb. small fillets

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine cheese, flour and seasonings.
Dip catfish into combined egg and milk; dredge in cheese mixture.
Place into baking dish.
Pour margarine over catfish.
Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown.

title: Chicken Casserole Serves 12
description: Family recipe for Chicken Casserole Serves 12. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: pkg Seasoned Long Grain & Wild Rice Mix
Salt, Pepper & Garlic Salt to taste

instructions.instruction: Sprinkle chicken with lemon juice. Add cooked rice and the next seven ingredients. Mix well. Spoon into a greased 9x13 baking dish. Top with almonds and cracker crumbs.
Bake in a 350 degree oven about 25 minutes.

title: Chicken Dressing Casserole Jan G
description: Family recipe for Chicken Dressing Casserole Jan G. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Saute Onion in Butter 10 mins. Mix Soups, Milk & Sage. Combine cornbread with broth, then add soup mixture. Bake in 13x9.2 Pan at 350° for 30 mins.

title: Chicken Rice Casserole
description: Family recipe for Chicken Rice Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix soup and water.
Blend in mayonnaise and add other ingredients, except onion rings.
Put in greased casserole dish.
Bake at 350 degrees F. 20 minutes. And then add onion rings.
Bake 10 more minutes.

title: Chicken Spaghetti
description: Family recipe for Chicken Spaghetti. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Lightly sauté onions and green peppers in the oleo.
Cook spaghetti in chicken broth – (break spaghetti into small pieces for cooking).
Drain spaghetti if any fluid is left.
While spaghetti is hot, cut Velveta cheese in small pieces and mix with spaghetti.
Add tomatoes, peas, oleo, onions, peppers and cut-up chicken.
Bake amount desired 40-45 minutes at 350 degrees F.
Makes a very large amount. Freezes well.

title: Chicken Spaghetti Version 2
description: Family recipe for Chicken Spaghetti Version 2. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Simmer onions, bell pepper, cellery and garlic in bacon drippings until tender. Add tomatoes and tomato soup. Add cut chicken. Add chicken broth and cook over low heat for about 20 minutes. Season with salt, black pepper and Cayenne pepper and Worstershire.
Cook spaghetti and drain. Then, in a big bowl, layer spaghetti, sauce and cheese until all used.
I bake amount to be used in a casserole dish for 15 minutes at 350 degrees F.
Serve with Parmesan cheese if desired.

title: Chipped Beef Casserole
description: Family recipe for Chipped Beef Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix in casserole. Mix together macaroni. Set in refr. - 4 hr. Salt & pepper. Cook about 1 hour.

title: Chocolate Chess Pie
description: Family recipe for Chocolate Chess Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix sugar and cocoa, then add melted butter, mix, then add eggs and salt, mix. Then add milk and vanilla and beat with mixer 2½ minutes.
Pour into 8 or 9-inch unbaked pie shell and bake at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes. (I bake mine for 45 min.)

notes: This pie is very good with or without Cool Whip Topping or Pure Whipped Cream. Nuts may be added to the topping or in the filling.

title: Christmas Breakfast Sausage Casserole
description: Family recipe for Christmas Breakfast Sausage Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s white bread, toasted and cut into cubes

title: Coconut Almond Pound Cake
description: Family recipe for Coconut Almond Pound Cake. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two standard loaf pans (9 x 5 x 3-inch).
Beat shortening and sugar together. Beat in eggs.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt together. Alternately add flour mixture and the buttermilk to the sugar mixture, stirring vigorously.
Fold in coconut flakes and coconut extract. Bake for 45-55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached.

Remove from oven and cool 5 minutes. Poke many holes on top of each loaf with a toothpick or a bamboo skewer and pour half the glaze on each cake. Cool another 10 minutes and remove from pan to a cooling rack to completely cool.

title: Coconut Pie Bayleys
description: Family recipe for Coconut Pie Bayleys. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Bring milk, butter & sugar to a boil. Add other ingredients - stir till cream. Add coconut.

title: Comeback Sauce Recipe
description: Family recipe for Comeback Sauce Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: chili sauce (I prefer Heinz or DelMonte. DO NOT substitute Thai Chili Sauce)

instructions.instruction: Mix all ingredients well and store in refrigerator overnight. It needs to sit to let the flavors become "acquainted". They shouldn't rush into marriage.

title: Coon Cheese Sausage Biscuits
description: Family recipe for Coon Cheese Sausage Biscuits. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: pkg. Coon Cheese (think also called New York?...in a black pkg, cheese kinda whitish)

instructions.instruction: Melt cheese in double boiler; add sausage & mix.
Pour into mixing bowl & add bisquick. Make into balls.
Bake on lightly greased cookie sheet at 350 until lightly browned.

title: Corn Chowder Soup
description: Family recipe for Corn Chowder Soup. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: 1 small can cream corn
1 can cream chicken soup
1 can cream celery soup
1 small can pet milk
1 cup water

title: Corn Rice Casserole
description: Family recipe for Corn Rice Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: PKG. YELLOW (SAFFRON) RICE - (MAHATMA) COOK AS DIRECTED
CARTON SOUR CREAM ONION DIP (16 oz.)

instructions.instruction: MIX ALL THIS AND ADD TO RICE. POUR INTO CASSEROLE AND BAKE TILL IT BUBBLES ON 350 DEGREES.

title: Cranberry Nut Bread Recipe
description: Family recipe for Cranberry Nut Bread Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Pre-heat oven to 350°F.
Mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Add the chopped cranberries and walnuts to coat with the flour mixture.
Mix together orange juice, butter, egg, and orange peel. Add to flour, cranberry, nut mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until just blended.
Pour into a greased 9x5 or 8x4 loaf pan. Bake at 350°F for 55 to 60 minutes or until done (a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean).
Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.

title: Cranberry Orange Scones Full Recipe
description: Family recipe for Cranberry Orange Scones Full Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: C. butter, room temperature, cut into small pieces
to 1 Cup (to suit taste) of fresh or frozen cranberries

instructions.instruction: Coat cranberries with brown sugar, distributing the sugar so as many cranberries as possible get coated.
Combine dry ingredients plus grated orange peel; cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

In small bowl, whisk eggs, orange juice and milk. (Save a couple of tablespoons to brush tops of scones before baking.) Stir into flour mixture, combining until dough is moist. If it is too sticky to handle, add a bit more flour. Mix in the cranberries.
Turn dough onto floured work surface; knead a few turns.

title: Crazy Custard Pie
description: Family recipe for Crazy Custard Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Blend in blender - pour in greased pie pan - sprinkle with nutmeg if desired
Bake at 325° for 40 minutes - Cool about 20 min.

title: Crunchy Chicken Recipe
description: Family recipe for Crunchy Chicken Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix above ingredients together.
Dip Chicken in lemon Juice.
Coat Chicken with the above mixed dry ingredients.
Sautee in olive oil in a skillet with medium heat until golden brown.

notes:
included:**
*Mix: 1 cup chopped pecans, ½ cup Parmesan cheese, ½ tsp Garlic salt, ½ tsp Dried basil. Dip in lemon juice. Coat with above mixture. Sautee in olive oil in med. heat.*

title: Crunch Catfish With Lemon Butter Sauce
description: Family recipe for Crunch Catfish With Lemon Butter Sauce. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees.
Mix the eggs and water in a shallow bowl.
Combine the crackers, cheese, and seasoning on a plate.
Dredge the fillets in the eggs and then coat with the cracker mixture.
Place in a greased casserole, and drizzle with the melted butter.
Bake for about 30 minutes.
½ stick butter
Juice of 1 lemon
¼ cup green onions, sliced
Salt and pepper

title: Delicious Ham And Potato Soup
description: Family recipe for Delicious Ham And Potato Soup. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: ground white or black pepper, or to taste

instructions.instruction:
**
Combine the potatoes, celery, onion, ham and water in a stockpot. Bring to a boil, then cook over medium heat until potatoes are tender, about 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the chicken bouillon, salt and pepper.

In separate saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat. Whisk in flour with fork, and cook, stirring constantly until thick, about 1 minute. Slowly stir in milk as not to allow lumps to form until all milk has been added. Continue stirring over medium-low heat until thick, 4 to 5 minutes.
Stir milk mixture into stockpot, and cook soup until heated through. Serve immediately.

title: Dorothy Browns Breakfast Casserole
description: Family recipe for Dorothy Browns Breakfast Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Brown sausage then drain it. Place sausage back in skillet. Add cream cheese to melt it.
Unroll 1 can of crescent rolls place on in a 13 x 9 dish. Spread sausage mixture over crescent rolls. Cover with grated cheese. Place the 2nd can of crescent rolls on top.
Bake about 20 minutes or until golden brown.

title: French Bread
description: Family recipe for French Bread. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix yeast until dissolved in ½ cup of water.
In large bowl dissolve sugar and salt in remaining 1 cup warm water.
Add shortening and yeast mixture.
Mix well, add flour.
Work through dough with spoon every 10 minutes for 1-3 times.
Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and divide in half.
Shape into two balls.
Let rest 10 minutes.
Make into two loaves.
Cover with towel and let rise 1½ hours.
Bake at 375° for 35 minutes.
Brush with melted butter.

title: Fresh Blueberry Pie
description: Family recipe for Fresh Blueberry Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Adjust rack 4 or 5 inches above bottom of oven. Start oven 30 min before baking; set to hot (450° F).

Make pastry; roll out ⅔ of it and line a 9-inch pie pan, fitting well into angles; trim off even with pan rim. Sprinkle crumbs evenly over bottom of pastry-lined pan. Roll out remaining pastry for top crust; cut design in center for wide-open steam vents. Pick over berries, discarding damaged ones and wash thoroughly in cold water. Drain. Blend flour with sugar and salt and sprinkle ⅔ cup of it over crumbs, then turn in berries, spreading out compactly. Drizzle lemon juice over berries; then sprinkle rest of sugar mixture over top. Dot with butter, then moisten edge of lower pastry; lay on top pastry. Press gently around edge to seal. Trim off top pastry with scissors ½-inch beyond pan rim. Fold overhang under bottom pastry so fold is even with pan rim. Again press gently to seal, then crimp edge with tines of a fork. Bake 12 to 15 min or until pastry begins to brown, then reduce heat to moderately slow (325° F) and bake 20 to 25 min longer or until pastry is nicely browned and juice bubbles up through vents. Remove to cake rack to cool to lukewarm. 5 to 6 servings.

title: Frozen North Dressing Potato Casserole
description: Family recipe for Frozen North Dressing Potato Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s Frozen North Dressing Potatoes (diced, thawed)

instructions.instruction: Mix together. Put in 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with crushed Corn Flakes. Bake 1 Hr. & Min. at 350°.

title: Grape Salad
description: Family recipe for Grape Salad. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s. red or green seedless grapes

instructions.instruction: Mix top ingredients and put in 9 x 13 dish.
Put pecan/brown sugar mixture on top of grape mixture and let set. Salad is better after it has set for 2 or 3 hours.
(I have used grapes whole and cut in half -- either way works, your choice. I usually wash grapes and set aside. Mix cream cheese, sour cream, and vanilla and then stir in grapes, whole or half.)

title: Green Bean Corn Casserole
description: Family recipe for Green Bean Corn Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix & bake! - With topped Ritz cracker crumbs (with butter). 350° - 45 mins.

title: Hamburg Noodle Bake
description: Family recipe for Hamburg Noodle Bake. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: Lemon juice, ¼ teasp. garlic salt

instructions.instruction: Mix with 5 cups cooked noodles (cook 4 cup broken noodles) Put to greased 11 X 7-inch baking dish.
In 10-inch skillet cook ½ cup minced onion and ¼ cup minced green pepper in 1 tablesp. butter & oleo. Until tender.

Add 1 lbs. ground lean beef. Stir now & then until brown Stir in 8 oz. can tomato sauce and ½ cup catsup. Cook over med. heat - 5 min. Until mixture thickens. Spread over noodles. Bake 325° oven 10 min. Until bubbly. Let serve.

title: Ham Croquettes
description: Family recipe for Ham Croquettes. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: finely chopped onion (I use a little more)

instructions.instruction: Melt 3 tablespoon butter and blend in ⅓ cup all-purpose flour.
Add ½ teaspoon salt and 1 cup milk. Cook quickly, stirring constantly, until thick. Cool.
Add 2 cups coarsely ground cooked ham (I do this in food processor).
Add 1 tablespoon finely ground onion (I use more) and 2 tablespoons of prepared mustard.
Chill.
Shape into croquettes.
Dip in one beaten egg, then in ½ cup fine cracker crumbs. Let stand a few minutes.
Fry in a deep hot fat at 375 degrees for 7 to 8 minutes, or until brown.
Drain on paper towels.

title: Ham Loaf Supreme
description: Family recipe for Ham Loaf Supreme. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: ground smoked ham (I used honey baked and ground in my food processor)
minced parsley, fresh or dried (I used fresh)

instructions.instruction: Mix all the above and divide evenly into 2 greased loaf pans.
Bake at 350 degree for 30 minutes.
Then pour over the glaze and reduce heat to 325 degrees and bake an additional 50 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.
½ cup dark brown sugar
¼ cup cider vinegar
¾ teaspoon dry mustard
½ cup mayonnaise
½ cup sour cream
¼ cup prepared mustard
1 tablespoon prepared horseradish
½ teaspoon lemon juice

title: Ham Steak
description: Family recipe for Ham Steak. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Simmer this for 5 minutes and pour over ham steak and marinate for 4 hours. (I turn the steak over 2 or 3 times while marinating).
**2 or 3 pound slice center cut ham**
Cook on outdoor grill over low fire about 45 minutes (depending on how thick the steak is) turning every 5 to 10 minutes.

title: Hash Brown Potato Casserole
description: Family recipe for Hash Brown Potato Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: (2 lb.) bag of frozen brown potatoes, thawed for about 45 minutes

title: Hot Bread
description: Family recipe for Hot Bread. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix all ingredients, except corn meal well. Add corn meal and bake at 400° till brown.

title: Hot Fruit
description: Family recipe for Hot Fruit. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Pour this over fruit and heat in 325 to 350 oven about 20 or 30 minutes.

title: Ice Box Fruit Cake
description: Family recipe for Ice Box Fruit Cake. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Melt marshmallows and butter over low heat. Add crushed graham crackers, cherries, raisins and nuts. Mix well put into buttered loaf pan and refrigerate 12 hours or longer. Remove from pan and wrap in foil or plastic wrap.
Remove cake from pan. Wrap in aluminum foil or plastic wrap.

notes: We like it without raisins, but you will need more cherries. Cake keeps refrigerated for weeks. We cut the slices we want to eat and return uncut loaf to refrigerator.

title: Italian Cream Cake
description: Family recipe for Italian Cream Cake. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Grease and flour three nine-inch round cake pans. Line pans with wax paper; grease paper, and set aside.

Beat butter at medium speed of an electric mixer until creamy; gradually add sugar, beating well. Add egg yolks, one at a time, beating after each addition. Combine flour and baking soda. Add buttermilk and flour alternately, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Stir in pecans, vanilla, and coconut.
Beat egg whites at high speed in a large bowl until foamy. Add cream of tartar; beat until stiff peaks form. Gently fold beaten egg whites into batter. Pour batter into prepared pans.

Bake at 350 degrees for 25 or 30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool in pans 10 minutes, remove from pans; peel off wax paper; and let cool completely on wire racks. Brush each cake layer with 1 tablespoon Grand Marnier. Let stand 10 minutes. Spread cream cheese frosting between layers and on sides and top of cake.

title: Jim Buck Ross Blueberry Buttermilk Muffins
description: Family recipe for Jim Buck Ross Blueberry Buttermilk Muffins. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Combine dry ingredients in a mixing bowl; set aside.
Combine egg, buttermilk and butter, mix well.
Make a well in the center of dry ingredients.
Stir just until moistened.
Fold in the blueberries.
Fill greased muffin pan 2/3 full.
Bake at 425 degrees for 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven immediately.

title: Karo Pecan Pie
description: Family recipe for Karo Pecan Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Stir the first five ingredients thoroughly using a spoon. Mix in pecans.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake on center rack of oven for 60-70 minutes.
Cool for 2 hours.
Store in refrigerator.

title: Lasagne
description: Family recipe for Lasagne. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: **STEP 1.** Brown beef - add next 5 ingredients and simmer covered 20 minutes.
**STEP 2.** Cook lasagne noodles.
**STEP 3.** Whip the next 3 ingredients together until well mixed.

In a greased dish (13x9) put a layer of lasagne noodles to cover bottom. Then spread ½ cream cheese mixture on noodles; then ½ meat mixture on top of cream cheese mixture; then repeat once. Top with 12 oz. grated cheddar cheese. Bank 350° for 45 minutes. Let set up about 30 minutes before cutting.
Lasagne should be in this order: noodles, cream cheese mixture, meat mixture, noodles, cream cheese mixture, meat mixture, grated cheese.

notes: added:** I put 3 layers of everything. I know it will seem skimpy with the cheese mixture that it all worked out -

title: Lolas Southern Buttermilk Pie
description: Family recipe for Lolas Southern Buttermilk Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

title: Maes Chicken Salad
description: Family recipe for Maes Chicken Salad. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

title: Maui Pineapple Scones
description: Family recipe for Maui Pineapple Scones. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: crushed pineapple, drained, reserve 1 tablespoon juice

title: Meat Balls Spaghetti
description: Family recipe for Meat Balls Spaghetti. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Wesson Oil
2 med. onions
4 buttons garlic
2 large cans tomato paste
2 T. sugar
About a quart of water.

title: Meat Loaf
description: Family recipe for Meat Loaf. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: table sp. chopped onion, ½ cup celery

instructions.instruction: Put meat in mixing bowl - add onion soup mix & mix, add cracker crumbs and pepper.
Soak bread slices in milk, add catsup, and oil, then add to meat mixture & mix lightly.
Then add onion, bell pepper, and celery, and eggs - mix, then sprinkle baking powder and mix lightly, put in loaf pan (greased).
Bake 2½ hrs - 375° for about 15 min - then 300°.

title: Meat Loaf Pizza
description: Family recipe for Meat Loaf Pizza. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: A meat loaf turned - filled wet and filled with tomato and cheese.

instructions.instruction: Bake 425° for 35 min. Serves 6 at 280 Calories each.
1½ lbs. extra lean ground pork
1 teaspoon salt
¼ teaspoon pepper
¼ to ½ teaspoon garlic powder or to suit taste
1 cup tomato sauce or pizza sauce
3 oz. shredded part skim mozzarella
1 tablespoon leaf oregano, crumbled
Sprinkle ground meat with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Gently pat into a 10-inch pie plate, building the rim. Bake in hot oven (425°) 15 min.
Add tomato or pizza sauce and sprinkle with cheese and oregano. Bake 10 min longer, or until hot and bubbly. Drain off any fat.

notes:
**
- Chopped peppers (green), mushroom slices, onions or whatever else you like on pizza are all good additions - Anything but sausage. Serve in wedges.
- This is another of our favorites! I use ¼ tsp. garlic.

**Instructions continued:**
They then slightly and keep apart from slices. They can be frozen quickly on cookie sheet and store in plastic bag. This method will prevent sticking together.

(I use the lean ground beef.) Another version of stuffing:

1½ lbs. coarsely ground cooked meat or lean ground beef cooked until all pink is gone. (Lean beef)
2 eggs, slightly beaten
½ cup finely minced onion
1 cup dried bread crumbs
½ tsp. salt (optional)
¾ to 1 tsp. oregano - crushed
1/8 tsp. pepper (salt & taste)

Moisten with milk if desired. Mix thoroughly and proceed as in previous recipe.

title: Meat Stuffing For Jumbo Shells Or Manicotti
description: Family recipe for Meat Stuffing For Jumbo Shells Or Manicotti. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s. cooked chopped meat - (beef or mix of beef & pork) or ground beef cooked until all pink is gone - (lean beef)

instructions.instruction: Season with pepper, salt and parsley well. Mix thoroughly and stuff. Manicotti or Jumbo Shells cooked according to directions.
Lay in a row in greased baking dish. Two 10½ oz cans of spaghetti sauce or one 32 oz are required.
Pour most of sauce over manicotti (or Jumbo shells). Cover and bake 25 or 30 min. in 350° oven. Before serving add rest of sauce (heated) And sprinkle with Parmesan Cheese.
The stuffed shells freeze very well.

title: Morning Glory Muffins
description: Family recipe for Morning Glory Muffins. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

title: My Favorite Biscotti
description: Family recipe for My Favorite Biscotti. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: eggs, 2 egg yolks, and one egg white for brushing
s granulated sugar, plus extra for sprinkling
Tbs. almond liqueur, such as Disaronno

instructions.instruction: Adjust oven rack to lower-middle and upper positions and heat oven to 325 degrees. Line two large, rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper.

Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Beat eggs, egg yolks and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light, about 3 minutes; beat in vanilla, liqueur and anise. Beat in dry ingredients and then almonds to form sticky dough.

Divide dough into four portions on a heavily floured board and rolling each portion into an approximate 15- by 2-inch log. Carefully transfer 2 logs to each baking sheet, brushing each with egg white and sprinkling with sugar. Bake until pale golden and just beginning to crack, 20 to 25 minutes.

Cool cookie logs on baking sheet until tepid, about 10 minutes. Keeping loaves in position, heat oven to 200 degrees. Slice logs crosswise, 3/4-inch thick with a serrated knife, laying slices on baking sheets in single layer. (There will be enough cookies for 4 to 6 sheets.) Working 2 sheets at a time, bake biscotti until crisp 2 and golden, about 25 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. (Can be stored in airtight container up to 2 weeks.)

title: Nut Cake 2 Loaves
description: Family recipe for Nut Cake 2 Loaves. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Sift flour and spices together. Combine whiskey and molasses and add soda. Cream shortening and sugar. Add egg yolks, beating well. Alternately add liquid and flour. Beat egg whites and fold into mixture. Add chopped fruit and nuts. Bake 250° for 1 hr and 45 min. Put pan of water under cake.
Makes 2 cakes (tube pan)

title: Old Fashioned Cornbread Dressing Southern Living
description: Family recipe for Old Fashioned Cornbread Dressing Southern Living. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Combine first 4 ingredients. Add eggs, buttermilk, bacon drippings & mix. Pour into a heated (450° oven-4 Min) 10" skillet & bake 35 mins. (light brown). Cool, crumble.
Saute celery & onion in butter. Combine cornbread & onion & remaining ingredients. Mix well. Put in lightly buttered 13/9/2 pan. Bake at 450° 25-30 mins)
Yield: 8 servings.

title: Old Fashioned Short Cake
description: Family recipe for Old Fashioned Short Cake. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix these ingredients together. Cut in ½ cup shortening.

Combine ½ cup milk with 1 egg - add to flour - stir until soft dough is formed - put on lightly floured board and knead 20 times. Roll or pat ½ inch thick, cut with biscuit cutter. Brush with melted butter - put top on. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet until golden brown at 400° - separate while still warm - fill with strawberries.

title: Panko Crusted Salmon Recipe
description: Family recipe for Panko Crusted Salmon Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s thickly cut, boneless salmon (each 6 oz)

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 400°F (convection or regular). Set the salmon on a foil-lined baking sheet skin side down. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

In a small bowl, combine the honey mustard and 1 teaspoon of the thyme. In another small bowl, mix the panko with the remaining 1 teaspoon of thyme, 4 teaspoons of olive oil, parsley, and paprika. Add salt and pepper (a light sprinkle).

title: Paradise Pineapple Pie
description: Family recipe for Paradise Pineapple Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: carton (12 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed

instructions.instruction: Place the milk in a bowl; fold in whipped topping. Add lemon juice and topping.
Till or whipped and lemon juice until ready for 7 minutes.
Pour until slightly thickened.
Pour into crusts; sprinkle with coconut. Crust and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Yield: 2 pies (16 servings, 1/8 each).

title: Pear Honey Recipe
description: Family recipe for Pear Honey Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s (about 6 pounds) peeled, cored, and chopped pears

instructions.instruction: Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan. Cook until pears are tender and mixture thickens, approximately 30 minutes. Transfer to sterilized jars and seal while still hot*.

title: Pecan Pie
description: Family recipe for Pecan Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix sugar, karo, butter, vanilla and eggs. Pour over pecans in pie shell. Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes.
If you find your pie gets to hard on top, put a pan of water in oven on top rack over pie while baking.

title: Pecan Pie 1
description: Family recipe for Pecan Pie 1. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cream together - put in 9" pastry. Bake at 375° - nicely browned. Cool.

Temperature: 375°
Time: Bake 40-45'
*

notes: Files very for flour*

title: Pickapeppa Marinated Chicken
description: Family recipe for Pickapeppa Marinated Chicken. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Marinate boneless chicken breast 8 hours up to overnight.
Grill to perfection on the BBQ grill.
Marinates 4-5 chicken breast depending on size.

notes: I like to double the marinate for added flavor. If you cook extra chicken this is so good left over and cut up on a green salad.

title: Pistachio Salad
description: Family recipe for Pistachio Salad. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix in order listed - pour into glass bowl. Let chill.
(This is a sweet salad, good with ham, chicken or turkey.)

notes: This also could be used as dessert by pouring into a graham cracker crust and chill about three hrs.

title: Potato Green Onion Soup
description: Family recipe for Potato Green Onion Soup. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: (10 oz.) Can Cream of Celery soup

instructions.instruction: Cook potatoes & onions in 3-qt soup pot with chicken broth until tender. Strain vegetables. Save broth. Put potatoes & onions in blender with soup & milk. Blend until smooth. Return blended mixture to soup pot with broth. Add seasonings & heat.
**Yields:** 4 servings
(One large yellow onion may be substituted for green onions.)

title: Putn On The Ritz
description: Family recipe for Putn On The Ritz. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Soften cream cheese in a mixing bowl. Add mayonnaise, Swiss cheese, and green onions; mix well. Transfer to a baking dish. Top with bacon and crackers. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with bagels, chips, or toasted French break.

title: Quiche
description: Family recipe for Quiche. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Beat eggs & milk & biscuit mix. Add other ingredients. Put in (?) pie shell and bake about 30 min at 375°.

title: Raisin Bran Muffins
description: Family recipe for Raisin Bran Muffins. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s (15 oz. box) Natural Raisin Bran

instructions.instruction: Blend flour, baking soda, and salt in large mixing bowl. Stir in cereal. Add buttermilk, oil and eggs and blend until dry ingredients are moistened. Do not stir batter again. (Mixture may be stored, covered in a non-metal bowl in refrigerator for up to six weeks.) As needed, fill lightly greased muffin pans 2/3 full. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes. If desired, lightly brush melted butter over batter and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar before baking. Makes about 4 dozen muffins.

notes: Recipe may be halved.

title: Raw Cranberry Salad
description: Family recipe for Raw Cranberry Salad. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Dissolve gelatin in hot water. Mix all ingredients and pour into glass bowl. Congeal.

title: Red Velvet Cake
description: Family recipe for Red Velvet Cake. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cream shortening & sugar. One at a time add food color, then vanilla, eggs. Mix well. Sift flour, cocoa, salt. Add flour & milk to creamed mix. Blend in vinegar & soda. Grease & flour. Bake 350 - 30 minutes.

title: Salmon Croquettes
description: Family recipe for Salmon Croquettes. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: can pink salmon, drain and save juice

instructions.instruction: Mix salmon and egg with fork.
Add ½ cup sifted flour and stir. Mixture will be thick.
Add pepper, onions and Worcestershire.
In the ¼ cup salmon juice, put the baking powder and beat with fork until it foams.
Pour this into salmon mixture and mix with fork.
Drop by small spoonfuls into deep hot fat.
Be sure and cook within 15 minutes of mixing.

title: Salmon Loaf
description: Family recipe for Salmon Loaf. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.
notes: Instructions appear incomplete in the original handwritten recipe)*

title: Salted Pecans Express Printing
description: Family recipe for Salted Pecans Express Printing. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Bring w t s to boil. Remove from heat add pecans and let set 10 min. Strain and spread on cookie sheet. Cook 2½ hr at 225°.

**Express Printing**  
*1440 OLD SQUARE ROAD ■ JACKSON, MISSISSIPPI 39211*

title: Sausage Biscuit Snackmeal
description: Family recipe for Sausage Biscuit Snackmeal. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: sausage (Jimmy Dean, or any brand you like)

instructions.instruction: Heat oven to 350 degrees.
Open biscuits and peel off half of the biscuit.
Place biscuit half into nonstick muffin pan - firmly push dough into the pan making sure it comes up on the side a little bit. (8 biscuits will make 16)
Brown sausage and onion in skillet over medium heat.
Stir and break up sausage while browning to make small pieces.
Drain when cooked.
Add Cajun seasoning.
Beat eggs.
Add the milk to the beaten eggs and stir.
Add eggs to cooked sausage and cook until eggs are done.
Take off heat and sprinkle cheese on mixture and mix well.
Put 1 1/2 tbsp. of mixture onto biscuit half and cook for 14 to 17 minutes.

title: Sausage Egg Casserole
description: Family recipe for Sausage Egg Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Brown sausage and drain.
Beat eggs, cube the bread, and add all other ingredients.
Mix well with the sausage and pour into greased 9 X 13 inch glass baking dish.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
In morning, bake at 350° (uncovered) for 45-60 minutes.

title: Shrimp Casserole Express Printing
description: Family recipe for Shrimp Casserole Express Printing. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix & bake. Ritz crackers - 1 stick oleo. Cook 350° - 45 min.

title: Shrimp Dip
description: Family recipe for Shrimp Dip. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix all ingredients together and serve with crackers and/or chips.

title: Sour Cream Biscuits Recipe
description: Family recipe for Sour Cream Biscuits Recipe. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Mix all ingredients thoroughly. I do so by hand.

Bake in regular muffin pan at 400 degrees until brown, or
Bake at 375 degrees if you use no-stick pan.

notes: I prefer the no-stick (Teflon lined) pan that makes 24 small muffins, just the right number for this recipe. This pan has the brand-name of Wilton. Each cup is 1¾ inches in diameter at the top.

title: Squash Dressing
description: Family recipe for Squash Dressing. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: cream of chicken or cream of mushroom soup

instructions.instruction: Chop onion. Saute onion lightly in the oleo. Mash squash with fork. Mix all ingredients well and pour into greased casserole. Bake at 350 F. degrees 20-25 minutes, uncovered.

title: Stuffed Peppers
description: Family recipe for Stuffed Peppers. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: long bell peppers cut in half lengthwise
spicy hot V-8 juice (tomato juice or Reg. V-8 juice)

instructions.instruction: Sauté onion in oleo, add V-8 juice, water, chopped ham, salt, pepper, tabasco and cook about 45 minutes over low heat.
When this has cooked down add cracker crumbs and egg. Stuff peppers and sprinkle top with cracker crumbs and melted oleo.
Bake about 30 minutes in a covered casserole at 350° uncovered and bake 10 or 15 min. longer.

title: Stuffing For Flounder
description: Family recipe for Stuffing For Flounder. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Sauté onions, celery, and garlic in oleo over low heat.
Add bread and seasonings, mix well.
Add shrimp, crab meat, parsley and egg.
Bake on baking dish with flounder fillets, until fish is done, about 30 minutes.

title: Sweet Potato Pie
description: Family recipe for Sweet Potato Pie. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cook potatoes and mash.
Add sugar, milk, butter, eggs and vanilla.
Mix well.
Put in unbaked pie shell.
Bake one hour at 350 degrees F.

notes: As an option to putting the mixture in a pie shell: This potato mixture can be put in a baking dish, topped with marshmallows and baked at 350 degrees until marshmallows are light brown.

title: Sweet Potato Pie 1
description: Family recipe for Sweet Potato Pie 1. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Cook potatoes and mash.
Add sugar, milk, butter, eggs and vanilla. Mix well.
Put in unbaked pie shell.
Bake 1 hr at 350°.

title: Tuna Casserole
description: Family recipe for Tuna Casserole. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Bake at 385° 15 min

title: Tylers Blueberry Scones With Lemon Glaze
description: Family recipe for Tylers Blueberry Scones With Lemon Glaze. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

items.ingredient: s unsalted butter, cold, cut in chunks
heavy cream, plus more for brushing the scones

instructions.instruction:
**
You can make the lemon glaze in a double boiler, or for a simpler alternative, you can zap it in the microwave. Mix the lemon juice with the confectioners' until dissolved in a heatproof bowl over a pot of simmering water for the double-boiler method, or in a microwave-safe bowl. Whisk in the butter and lemon zest. Either nuke the glaze for 30 seconds or continue whisking in the double boiler. Whisk the glaze to smooth out any lumps, then drizzle the glaze over the top of the scones. Let it set a minute before serving.

title: Various Appetizersdips
description: Family recipe for Various Appetizersdips. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: In 10-inch skillet cook ½ cup minced onion and ¼ cup minced green pepper in 1 tablesp. butter & oleo. Until tender.

Add 1 lbs. ground(lean) beef. Stir now & then until brown. Stir in 8 oz. can tomato sauce and ½ cup catsup. Cook over med. heat - 5 min. Until mixture thickens. Spread over noodles. Bake 325° oven 10 min. Until bubbly. Let serve.

notes:
Mix Nitch 5 cups Cooked noodles (cook 4 cup broken noodles) Put to greased 11 X 7-inch baking dish.

**Additional instructions from the second part:**
2. In 10-inch skillet cook ½ cup minced onion and ¼ cup minced green pepper in 1 tablesp. butter & oleo. Until tender.
3. Add 1 lbs. ground(lean) beef. Stir now & then until brown. Stir in 8 oz. can tomato sauce and ½ cup catsup. Cook over med. heat - 5 min. Until mixture thickens. Spread over noodles. Bake 325° oven 10 min. Until bubbly. Let serve.

*(This is one of our favorite casserole dishes.)*

title: Wild Rice
description: Family recipe for Wild Rice. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

instructions.instruction: Measure above into proper vessel with cover. Bring to a boil. Let simmer for one hour on top of stove with cover on vessel.

title: Zucchini Bread
description: Family recipe for Zucchini Bread. A cherished recipe passed down through generations.

title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Authentic Roman carbonara with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper - no cream needed!

instructions.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, whole egg, both cheeses, and black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water before draining the spaghetti.
Add the hot, drained pasta to the skillet with pancetta. Remove from heat.
Quickly pour the egg mixture over the pasta, tossing constantly with tongs.
Add pasta water gradually while tossing until you achieve a creamy consistency.
Serve immediately with additional cheese and black pepper.

notes: The key is to work quickly and keep the pasta hot to cook the eggs without scrambling them
Never add cream - it's not traditional carbonara
Use the starchy pasta water to create the silky sauce
variations: Use guanciale instead of pancetta for more authentic flavor
Add peas for carbonara primavera
Try with linguine or fettuccine
storage: Best served immediately, but leftovers can be refrigerated for 1 day

title: Homemade Pizza Margherita
description: Classic Neapolitan-style pizza with fresh mozzarella, basil, and San Marzano tomatoes

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, combine flour, yeast, and salt. Add olive oil and warm water.
Mix until a shaggy dough forms, then knead on a floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth.
Place in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise for 2 hours until doubled.
Meanwhile, make sauce by combining crushed tomatoes with minced garlic and a pinch of salt.
Preheat oven to its highest setting (usually 500-550°F) with a pizza stone if you have one.
Divide dough into 4 portions. Roll each into a thin circle on a floured surface.
Transfer to parchment paper. Spread thin layer of sauce, leaving a 1-inch border.
Add torn mozzarella pieces and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Remove from oven and immediately top with fresh basil leaves.

notes: 00 flour gives the most authentic texture, but bread flour works well too
A pizza stone or steel will give you a crispier crust
Don't overload with toppings - less is more for margherita
variations: Add prosciutto for a Prosciutto e Funghi
Use buffalo mozzarella for extra creaminess
Try whole wheat flour for a heartier crust
storage: Dough can be refrigerated for up to 3 days or frozen for 3 months

title: Chicken Tacos Al Pastor
description: Marinated chicken with pineapple, onions, and cilantro in warm corn tortillas

instructions.instruction: Toast the dried chiles in a dry skillet for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Soak chiles in hot water for 15 minutes until softened.
Blend soaked chiles with orange juice, vinegar, garlic, oregano, cumin, paprika, and salt until smooth.
Marinate chicken in the chile mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side until cooked through and slightly charred.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice into thin strips.
Warm tortillas on the grill or in a dry skillet.
Fill tortillas with chicken, pineapple, onion, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges and your favorite salsa.

notes: Chicken thighs stay more tender than breasts
Don't skip the marinating time for best flavor
Char the pineapple on the grill for extra flavor
variations: Use pork shoulder for traditional al pastor
Add pickled red onions for extra tang
Try with flour tortillas for a different texture
storage: Marinated chicken keeps for 2 days in refrigerator

title: Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup
description: Comforting chicken noodle soup made from scratch with tender vegetables and egg noodles

instructions.instruction: Place whole chicken in a large pot with water and bay leaves. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes until chicken is tender.
Remove chicken and let cool. Strain and reserve the broth.
When cool enough to handle, remove skin and shred chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Heat olive oil in the same pot over medium heat.
Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened, about 8 minutes.
Add garlic and thyme, cook for 1 minute more.
Add reserved broth and bring to a boil.
Add egg noodles and cook according to package directions.
Stir in shredded chicken and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes more and serve hot.

notes: Using a whole chicken creates the richest broth
Don't overcook the noodles - they'll continue cooking in the hot soup
Can substitute rotisserie chicken and store-bought broth for quicker version
variations: Add diced potatoes for heartier soup
Use rice instead of noodles for gluten-free option
Add fresh dill for different flavor profile
storage: Keeps in refrigerator for 3 days. Store noodles separately if possible to prevent mushiness
